alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 5:47PM CDT until September 21 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Grayson. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sherman, Denison, Bells, Savoy, Knollwood, Randell Lake, Valley Lake, Eisenhower State Park, Lake Texoma, Boddie, Ida, Carpenters Bluff and Ambrose.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
